long_description:
zend-server Cookbook ==================== TODO: Enter the cookbook description here. e.g. This cookbook makes your favorite breakfast sandwhich. Requirements ------------ TODO: List your cookbook requirements. Be sure to include any requirements this cookbook has on platforms, libraries, other cookbooks, packages, operating systems, etc. e.g. #### packages - `toaster` - zend-server needs toaster to brown your bagel. Attributes ---------- TODO: List you cookbook attributes here. e.g. #### zend-server::default
Key Type Description Default
['zend-server']['bacon'] Boolean whether to include bacon true
Usage ----- #### zend-server::default TODO: Write usage instructions for each cookbook. e.g. Just include `zend-server` in your node's `run_list`: ```json { "name":"my_node", "run_list": [ "recipe[zend-server]" ] } ``` Contributing ------------ TODO: (optional) If this is a public cookbook, detail the process for contributing. If this is a private cookbook, remove this section. e.g. 1. Fork the repository on Github 2. Create a named feature branch (like `add_component_x`) 3. Write you change 4. Write tests for your change (if applicable) 5. Run the tests, ensuring they all pass 6. Submit a Pull Request using Github License and Authors ------------------- Authors: TODO: List authors
name: zendserver

recipes.zendserver::manage: Manages zend server, typically no direct actions
recipes.zendserver::install: Adds the Zend Server repo and installs the package
recipes.zendserver::bootstrapsingle: Bootstraps the server in single server mode

zendserver/apikeysecret.description: An API key secret we can sbsequenly use (64 chars)

zendserver/phpversion.description: The PHP version to install - must be a valid PHP version for the Zend Server selected version

zendserver/production.description: Whether to set Zend Server up as a development or production server (Monitoring rules, agregation, ...).

zendserver/version.description: The version to install - must be a valid repository version

zendserver/apikeyname.description: An API key we can subsequently use
